sentences: John E. Carter (June 2, 1934 â€“ August 21, 2009) was an American doo-wop and R&B singer.
He was a founding member of The Flamingos and a member of The Dells.
Both groups have been inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame, making Carter one of the few multiple inductees.
He joined The Dells as a replacement for Johnny Funches in 1960 and remained an active member of the group until his death.
He was a veteran of the United States Army where he served as a cook.
Carter died of lung cancer in Harvey, Illinois at the age of 75.
